tools.name: Cancel a crawl job
tools.description: Cancels an active or queued web crawl job using its ID; attempting to cancel completed, failed, or previously canceled jobs will not change their state.

id.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the crawl job to be canceled.
id.title: Id

status.description: Indicates the operation outcome. Value is 'cancelled' when the crawl job has been successfully cancelled.
status.title: Status

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Start a web crawl
tools.description: Initiates a Firecrawl web crawl from a given URL, applying various filtering and content extraction rules, and polls until the job is complete; ensure the URL is accessible and any regex patterns for paths are valid.

allowBackwardLinks.description: If true, allows the crawler to navigate to pages that were linked from pages already visited (i.e., navigate 'backwards'). Defaults to false.
allowBackwardLinks.title: Allow Backward Links

allowExternalLinks.description: If true, allows the crawler to follow links that lead to external websites (different domains). Defaults to false.
allowExternalLinks.title: Allow External Links

delay.description: Delay in milliseconds between requests to avoid overwhelming the server
delay.title: Delay

excludePaths.description: A list of Regular Expression (regex) patterns for URL paths to exclude from the crawl. URLs whose paths match any of these patterns will be ignored. For example, `"blog/archive/.*"` would exclude all paths under `/blog/archive/`.
excludePaths.title: Exclude Paths

ignoreQueryParameters.description: If true, ignore query parameters when determining if a URL has been visited
ignoreQueryParameters.title: Ignore Query Parameters

ignoreSitemap.description: If true, the crawler will ignore any sitemap.xml found on the website. Defaults to true.
ignoreSitemap.title: Ignore Sitemap

includePaths.description: A list of Regular Expression (regex) patterns for URL paths to include in the crawl. Only URLs whose paths match one of these patterns will be processed. For example, `"products/featured/.*"` would only include paths under `/products/featured/`.
includePaths.title: Include Paths

limit.description: Maximum number of pages to crawl. The crawl will stop once this limit is reached. Default is 10.
limit.title: Limit

maxDepth.description: Maximum depth of subpages to crawl relative to the base URL. A depth of 0 crawls only the base URL, 1 crawls the base URL and its direct links, etc. Default is 2.
maxDepth.title: Max Depth

maxDiscoveryDepth.description: Maximum depth for discovering new links, separate from crawling depth
maxDiscoveryDepth.title: Max Discovery Depth

scrapeOptions_actions.description: List of actions to perform on each page before scraping (e.g., clicking buttons, waiting)
scrapeOptions_actions.title: Scrape Options Actions

scrapeOptions_blockAds.description: If true, block advertisements during scraping
scrapeOptions_blockAds.title: Scrape Options Block Ads

scrapeOptions_changeTrackingOptions.description: Options for tracking changes between crawls
scrapeOptions_changeTrackingOptions.title: ChangeTrackingOptions

scrapeOptions_excludeTags.description: A list of HTML tags to exclude from the scraped output. Content within these tags (and their children) will be removed before processing.
scrapeOptions_excludeTags.title: Scrape Options Exclude Tags

scrapeOptions_formats.description: Specifies the desired output formats for the scraped content from each page. Default is `["markdown"]`. If format is json, jsonOptions is required.
scrapeOptions_formats.title: Scrape Options Formats

scrapeOptions_headers.description: Custom HTTP headers to send with each request
scrapeOptions_headers.title: Scrape Options Headers

scrapeOptions_includeTags.description: A list of HTML tags to specifically include in the scraped output. Only content within these tags will be processed. If empty or null, all relevant content is considered based on other options.
scrapeOptions_includeTags.title: Scrape Options Include Tags

scrapeOptions_jsonOptions.description: Options for JSON format extraction including schema and prompts
scrapeOptions_jsonOptions.title: JsonOptions

scrapeOptions_maxAge.description: Maximum age in seconds for cached content. If content is older than this, it will be re-scraped
scrapeOptions_maxAge.title: Scrape Options Max Age

scrapeOptions_mobile.description: If true, emulate a mobile device when scraping
scrapeOptions_mobile.title: Scrape Options Mobile

scrapeOptions_onlyMainContent.description: If true, attempts to extract only the main content of each page, excluding common elements like headers, navigation bars, and footers. Default is true.
scrapeOptions_onlyMainContent.title: Scrape Options Only Main Content

scrapeOptions_parsePDF.description: If true, attempt to parse PDF files encountered during crawling
scrapeOptions_parsePDF.title: Scrape Options Parse Pdf

scrapeOptions_removeBase64Images.description: If true, remove base64-encoded images from the scraped content
scrapeOptions_removeBase64Images.title: Scrape Options Remove Base64 Images

scrapeOptions_skipTlsVerification.description: If true, skip TLS certificate verification
scrapeOptions_skipTlsVerification.title: Scrape Options Skip Tls Verification

scrapeOptions_storeInCache.description: If true, store scraped content in cache for future use
scrapeOptions_storeInCache.title: Scrape Options Store In Cache

scrapeOptions_timeout.description: Timeout in milliseconds for each page request. Default is 30000ms (30 seconds)
scrapeOptions_timeout.title: Scrape Options Timeout

scrapeOptions_waitFor.description: The duration in milliseconds to wait for page JavaScript to execute and content to load before scraping. Useful for pages with dynamically loaded content. Default is 123ms.
scrapeOptions_waitFor.title: Scrape Options Wait For

url.description: The base URL to start crawling from. This is the initial entry point for the web crawler.
url.title: Url

webhook.description: An optional webhook URL to receive real-time updates on the crawl job. Events include crawl start (`crawl.started`), page crawled (`crawl.page`), and crawl completion (`crawl.completed` or `crawl.failed`). The payload structure matches the `/scrape` endpoint response.
webhook.title: Webhook

inputParameters.title: CrawlRequest
inputParameters.description: Parameters to initiate a web crawl, allowing customization of crawl depth, path inclusion/exclusion (regex), content extraction formats, and more, starting from a base URL.

creditsUsed.description: API credits consumed by this crawl job
creditsUsed.title: Credits Used

items.description: Data from a single crawled page.
items.title: CrawledPage

actions.description: Record of automated actions performed on the page (click, scroll, write, wait, press, etc.)
actions.title: Actions

extract.description: Structured data extracted from the page using LLM extraction
extract.title: Extract

html.description: Processed HTML content of the page
html.title: Html

links.description: Array of URLs found on the page
links.title: Links

markdown.description: Page content converted to clean, LLM-ready markdown format
markdown.title: Markdown

error.description: Error message if the page scrape failed
error.title: Error

language.description: Detected language of the page content
language.title: Language

ogLocaleAlternate.description: Array of alternative locale versions from Open Graph tags
ogLocaleAlternate.title: Og Locale Alternate

scrapeId.description: Unique identifier for this specific scrape operation
scrapeId.title: Scrape Id

sourceURL.description: Original URL that was requested for crawling
sourceURL.title: Source Url

statusCode.description: HTTP status code returned when accessing the page
statusCode.title: Status Code

title.description: Page title from the title tag
title.title: Title

rawHtml.description: Original unprocessed HTML content of the page
rawHtml.title: Raw Html

screenshot.description: Base64-encoded screenshot or URL of the rendered page
screenshot.title: Screenshot

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

expiresAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the crawl results will expire and be deleted
expiresAt.title: Expires At

next.description: URL for retrieving the next batch of results when response exceeds 10MB. Null when all data has been retrieved
next.title: Next

status.description: Current state of the crawl job. Possible values: 'scraping', 'completed', 'failed'
status.title: Status

success.description: Indicates whether the API call was successful
success.title: Success

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

total.description: Total number of pages identified to crawl
total.title: Total

warning.description: Warning message for issues like robots.txt limitations, low results, or other non-fatal problems. Null when no warnings
warning.title: Warning

tools.name: Start a web crawl (v2) [NEW]
tools.description: [NEW v2 API] Initiates a Firecrawl v2 web crawl with enhanced features over v1: natural language prompts for automatic crawler configuration, crawlEntireDomain for sibling/parent page discovery, better depth control with maxDiscoveryDepth, subdomain support, and full webhook configuration. Polls until crawl is complete.

allowExternalLinks.description: If true, allows the crawler to follow links that lead to external websites (different domains). Defaults to false.
allowExternalLinks.title: Allow External Links

allowSubdomains.description: If true, allows the crawler to follow links to subdomains of the main domain.
allowSubdomains.title: Allow Subdomains

crawlEntireDomain.description: Allows the crawler to follow internal links to sibling or parent URLs, not just child paths. False: Only crawls deeper (child) URLs (e.g., /features/feature-1 → /features/feature-1/tips). True: Crawls any internal links including siblings and parents (e.g., /features/feature-1 → /pricing, /).
crawlEntireDomain.title: Crawl Entire Domain

delay.description: Delay in seconds between scrapes to respect website rate limits.
delay.title: Delay

excludePaths.description: A list of Regular Expression (regex) patterns for URL paths to exclude from the crawl. URLs whose paths match any of these patterns will be ignored. For example, `"blog/archive/.*"` would exclude all paths under `/blog/archive/`.
excludePaths.title: Exclude Paths

ignoreQueryParameters.description: If true, do not re-scrape the same path with different (or no) query parameters
ignoreQueryParameters.title: Ignore Query Parameters

includePaths.description: A list of Regular Expression (regex) patterns for URL paths to include in the crawl. Only URLs whose paths match one of these patterns will be processed. For example, `"products/featured/.*"` would only include paths under `/products/featured/`.
includePaths.title: Include Paths

limit.description: Maximum number of pages to crawl. The crawl will stop once this limit is reached. Default is 10.
limit.title: Limit

maxConcurrency.description: Maximum number of concurrent scrapes. If not specified, uses your team's concurrency limit.
maxConcurrency.title: Max Concurrency

maxDiscoveryDepth.description: Maximum depth to crawl based on discovery order. The root site and sitemapped pages have a discovery depth of 0. For example, if you set it to 1 and set sitemap='skip', you will only crawl the entered URL and all URLs linked on that page.
maxDiscoveryDepth.title: Max Discovery Depth

prompt.description: A natural language prompt to automatically generate crawler settings. Example: 'Only crawl blog posts and docs, skip marketing pages'. Explicitly set parameters will override the generated equivalents.
prompt.title: Prompt
examples: Crawl documentation, skip tutorials and guides

scrapeOptions_actions.description: List of actions to perform on each page before scraping (e.g., clicking buttons, waiting)
scrapeOptions_actions.title: Scrape Options Actions

scrapeOptions_blockAds.description: If true, block advertisements during scraping
scrapeOptions_blockAds.title: Scrape Options Block Ads

scrapeOptions_excludeTags.description: A list of HTML tags to exclude from the scraped output. Content within these tags will be removed.
scrapeOptions_excludeTags.title: Scrape Options Exclude Tags

scrapeOptions_formats.description: Specifies the desired output formats for the scraped content from each page. Default is `["markdown"]`. If format is json, jsonOptions with systemPrompt is required.
scrapeOptions_formats.title: Scrape Options Formats

scrapeOptions_headers.description: Custom HTTP headers to send with each request
scrapeOptions_headers.title: Scrape Options Headers

scrapeOptions_includeTags.description: A list of HTML tags to specifically include in the scraped output. Only content within these tags will be processed.
scrapeOptions_includeTags.title: Scrape Options Include Tags

scrapeOptions_jsonOptions.description: Options for JSON format extraction. Use systemPrompt to define extraction schema/instructions and prompt for specific extraction requests.
scrapeOptions_jsonOptions.title: JsonOptions

systemPrompt.description: System prompt for JSON extraction (can include schema definition)
systemPrompt.title: System Prompt

scrapeOptions_maxAge.description: Maximum age in milliseconds for cached content. If content is older than this, it will be re-scraped.
scrapeOptions_maxAge.title: Scrape Options Max Age

scrapeOptions_mobile.description: If true, emulate a mobile device when scraping
scrapeOptions_mobile.title: Scrape Options Mobile

scrapeOptions_onlyMainContent.description: If true, attempts to extract only the main content of each page, excluding common elements like headers, navigation bars, and footers. Default is true.
scrapeOptions_onlyMainContent.title: Scrape Options Only Main Content

scrapeOptions_parsers.description: List of parsers to use for specific content types (e.g., 'pdf')
scrapeOptions_parsers.title: Scrape Options Parsers

scrapeOptions_removeBase64Images.description: If true, remove base64-encoded images from the scraped content
scrapeOptions_removeBase64Images.title: Scrape Options Remove Base64 Images

scrapeOptions_skipTlsVerification.description: If true, skip TLS certificate verification
scrapeOptions_skipTlsVerification.title: Scrape Options Skip Tls Verification

scrapeOptions_storeInCache.description: If true, store scraped content in cache for future use
scrapeOptions_storeInCache.title: Scrape Options Store In Cache

scrapeOptions_timeout.description: Timeout in milliseconds for each page request. Default is 30000ms (30 seconds)
scrapeOptions_timeout.title: Scrape Options Timeout

scrapeOptions_waitFor.description: The duration in milliseconds to wait for page JavaScript to execute and content to load before scraping.
scrapeOptions_waitFor.title: Scrape Options Wait For

sitemap.description: Sitemap mode when crawling. 'include' (default) uses sitemap and discovers other pages. 'skip' ignores sitemap entirely and only discovers pages from the start URL.
sitemap.title: Sitemap

url.description: The base URL to start crawling from. This is the initial entry point for the web crawler.
url.title: Url

webhook.description: Webhook configuration for receiving real-time crawl updates.
webhook.title: WebhookConfig

metadata.description: Custom metadata to include in webhook payload (string key-value pairs)
metadata.title: Metadata

url.description: Webhook URL to receive crawl updates
url.title: Url

zeroDataRetention.description: If true, enables zero data retention for this crawl. Contact help@firecrawl.dev to enable this feature.
zeroDataRetention.title: Zero Data Retention

inputParameters.title: CrawlV2Request
inputParameters.description: Parameters for Firecrawl v2 crawl API with enhanced discovery, natural language prompts, and granular control over crawl scope and content extraction.

completed.description: Number of pages successfully crawled and processed
completed.title: Completed

creditsUsed.description: API credits consumed by the crawl job
creditsUsed.title: Credits Used

data.description: Array of crawled page objects containing content and metadata
data.title: Data

items.description: Data from a single crawled page including content and metadata.
items.title: CrawledPage

actions.description: Results from browser actions performed during scraping.
actions.title: Actions

items.description: Result from JavaScript execution during browser actions.
items.title: JavaScriptReturn

type.description: Data type of the returned value
type.title: Type

value.description: The value returned from JavaScript execution
value.title: Value

pdfs.description: Array of PDF file URLs generated from actions
pdfs.title: Pdfs

scrapes.description: Array of scrape results from actions
scrapes.title: Scrapes

items.description: Result from a scrape action performed during browser automation.
items.title: ScrapeResult

screenshots.description: Array of screenshot URLs captured during actions
screenshots.title: Screenshots

html.description: Cleaned HTML content of the page
html.title: Html

links.description: Array of URLs found on the page
links.title: Links

markdown.description: Page content converted to markdown format
markdown.title: Markdown

metadata.description: Metadata extracted from the page including Open Graph tags, SEO data, and HTTP status
metadata.title: Metadata

canonical.description: Canonical URL reference from link tag
canonical.title: Canonical

error.description: Error message if the page failed to scrape
error.title: Error

msapplicationTileColor.description: Windows tile color for pinned sites
msapplicationTileColor.title: Msapplication Tile Color

ogImageHeight.description: Open Graph image height in pixels
ogImageHeight.title: Og Image Height

ogImageWidth.description: Open Graph image width in pixels
ogImageWidth.title: Og Image Width

ogLocaleAlternate.description: Array of alternate locale identifiers from Open Graph tags
ogLocaleAlternate.title: Og Locale Alternate

robots.description: Robot directives from meta tags (e.g., 'follow, index')
robots.title: Robots

sourceURL.description: The original URL that was scraped
sourceURL.title: Source Url

statusCode.description: HTTP status code of the response (e.g., 200, 404)
statusCode.title: Status Code

title.description: Page title from meta tags or title element
title.title: Title

rawHtml.description: Raw unprocessed HTML of the page
rawHtml.title: Raw Html

screenshot.description: Base64 encoded screenshot of the page
screenshot.title: Screenshot

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

expiresAt.description: ISO 8601 date-time format timestamp when the crawl data will expire
expiresAt.title: Expires At

next.description: URL for pagination to retrieve the next chunk of results. Present when response exceeds 10MB or crawl is incomplete. Absence indicates end of crawl data
next.title: Next

status.description: Current state of the crawl job
status.title: Status

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

total.description: Total number of pages identified in the crawl
total.title: Total

tools.name: Extract structured data
tools.description: Extracts structured data from web pages by initiating an extraction job and polling for completion; requires a natural language `prompt` or a JSON `schema` (one must be provided).

enable_web_search.description: If `True`, allows crawling links outside initial domains in `urls`; if `False`, restricts to same domains.
enable_web_search.title: Enable Web Search

prompt.description: Natural language query for information to extract from URL content. E.g., 'Extract the company mission, whether it supports SSO, etc.'
prompt.title: Prompt
examples: Extract the company mission, whether it supports SSO, etc.

schema.description: JSON object (dictionary) defining the desired structure for extracted data. Must be a valid JSON Schema object with properties and types.
schema.title: Schema

urls.description: A list of URLs from which to extract data (maximum 10 URLs while in beta). Wildcards (e.g., `https://example.com/blog/*`) can be used for crawling multiple pages under a specific path.
urls.title: Urls

inputParameters.title: ExtractRequest
inputParameters.description: Request to extract structured data from URLs via a `prompt` or `schema`.

data.description: Contains the structured data extracted from the URLs. The structure of this object depends on the schema or prompt defined in the extract request.
data.title: Data

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

expiresAt.description: Timestamp in ISO 8601 date-time format indicating when the extraction results expire (within 24 hours of creation).
expiresAt.title: Expires At

status.description: Current job state. Possible values: 'completed', 'processing', 'failed', or 'cancelled'.
status.title: Status

success.description: Indicates if the extraction request succeeded.
success.title: Success

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tokensUsed.description: Number of tokens consumed by the extraction job.
tokensUsed.title: Tokens Used

tools.name: Get the status of a crawl job
tools.description: Retrieves the current status, progress, and details of a web crawl job, using the job ID obtained when the crawl was initiated.

id.description: Unique identifier (UUID) of the crawl job.
id.title: Id

inputParameters.title: GetTheStatusOfACrawlJobRequest
inputParameters.description: Input for retrieving the status of a specific crawl job.

completed.description: The number of pages that have been successfully crawled.
completed.title: Completed

creditsUsed.description: The number of credits used for the crawl.
creditsUsed.title: Credits Used

data.description: Array of crawled page objects containing the extracted content.
data.title: Data

items.description: Data for a single crawled page.
items.title: CrawledPage

html.description: HTML version of the content on page if includeHtml is true.
html.title: Html

links.description: List of links on the page if includeLinks is true.
links.title: Links

metadata.description: Metadata object containing information extracted from the page.
metadata.title: Metadata

description.description: Description extracted from the page, can be a string or array of strings.
description.title: Description

error.description: The error message of the page if an error occurred.
error.title: Error

keywords.description: Keywords extracted from the page, can be a string or array of strings.
keywords.title: Keywords

language.description: Language extracted from the page, can be a string or array of strings.
language.title: Language

statusCode.description: The HTTP status code of the page.
statusCode.title: Status Code

title.description: Title extracted from the page, can be a string or array of strings.
title.title: Title

rawHtml.description: Raw HTML content of the page if includeRawHtml is true.
rawHtml.title: Raw Html

screenshot.description: Screenshot of the page if includeScreenshot is true.
screenshot.title: Screenshot

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

expiresAt.description: The date and time when the crawl will expire.
expiresAt.title: Expires At

next.description: The URL to retrieve the next 10MB of data. Returned if the crawl is not completed or if the response is larger than 10MB. Null when no additional data remains.
next.title: Next

status.description: The current status of the crawl. Can be 'scraping', 'completed', or 'failed'.
status.title: Status

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

total.description: The total number of pages that were attempted to be crawled.
total.title: Total

tools.name: Map multiple URLs
tools.description: Maps a website by discovering URLs from a starting base URL, with options to customize the crawl via search query, subdomain inclusion, sitemap handling, and result limits; search effectiveness is site-dependent.

ignoreSitemap.description: If true, the crawler ignores sitemap.xml files, relying on page links for discovery.
ignoreSitemap.title: Ignore Sitemap

includeSubdomains.description: If true, includes subdomains of the base URL in the mapping. E.g., if `url` is example.com, blog.example.com is mapped.
includeSubdomains.title: Include Subdomains

limit.description: Maximum number of unique links/pages to discover and return; helps control mapping scope and duration.
limit.title: Limit

search.description: Optional search query to guide URL mapping, prioritizing or finding specific page types. 'Smart' search is limited to 1000 initial results in Alpha, but overall mapping can exceed this.
search.title: Search

url.description: The primary base URL from which the mapping process will begin.
url.title: Url

inputParameters.title: MapMultipleUrlsBasedOnOptionsRequest
inputParameters.description: Request schema for mapping URLs based on various options.

links.description: Collection of discovered URLs with metadata, ordered from most relevant to least relevant when using search parameter
links.title: Links

items.description: Represents a discovered URL with optional metadata.
items.title: LinkResult

description.description: Page summary or meta description, availability varies by site
description.title: Description

title.description: Page title or heading, not always present depending on website
title.title: Title

url.description: Full URL of the discovered page
url.title: Url

success.description: Indicates whether the API call was successful
success.title: Success

warning.description: Warning message for alerts such as low results, robots.txt limitations, or other issues during mapping
warning.title: Warning

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Scrape URL
tools.description: Scrapes a publicly accessible URL, optionally performing pre-scrape browser actions or extracting structured JSON using an LLM, to retrieve content in specified formats.

actions.description: An optional list of browser actions (e.g., click, write, wait, press) to perform on the page before scraping. Useful for interacting with dynamic content, filling forms, or navigating through page elements.
actions.title: Actions

items.description: Action to perform on the page
items.title: Action

key.description: Key to press (e.g., 'Enter', 'Escape', 'Tab'), used with 'press' actions.
key.title: Key

milliseconds.description: Specifies a duration in milliseconds, e.g., for a 'wait' action or a delay.
milliseconds.title: Milliseconds

selector.description: CSS selector for the HTML element targeted by the action. Required for actions like 'click' or 'write'.
selector.title: Selector

text.description: Text to be typed into an element, used with 'write' actions.
text.title: Text

type.description: The type of browser action to perform on the page before scraping. Supported actions: 'wait', 'click', 'screenshot', 'write', 'press', 'scroll'.
type.title: Type

excludeTags.description: A list of HTML tags to specifically exclude from the output. Content within these tags will be removed.
excludeTags.title: Exclude Tags

formats.description: A list of desired output formats for the scraped content. Defaults to ['markdown']. Cannot include both 'screenshot' and 'screenshot@fullPage'. If 'json' is included, jsonOptions must be provided.
formats.title: Formats

includeTags.description: A list of HTML tags to specifically include in the output. Content within these tags will be prioritized.
includeTags.title: Include Tags

prompt.description: A user-defined prompt for data extraction when a specific JSON schema is not provided. Guides the LLM on what information to extract.
prompt.title: Prompt
examples: Extract the main headline and the first paragraph.
What are the product specifications mentioned on this page?
Summarize the article in three bullet points.

schema.description: A valid JSON Schema object defining the structure for data extraction. Must have 'type': 'object' at top level with 'properties' defined. The LLM will populate this schema with data from the page.
schema.title: Schema

systemPrompt.description: A system-level prompt to guide the LLM during JSON extraction, setting context or desired behavior.
systemPrompt.title: System Prompt
examples: Focus on product details and specifications.

country.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code to make the request from (e.g., 'US', 'AU', 'DE', 'JP').
country.title: Country

languages.description: List of preferred languages and locales for the request, in order of priority. Uses format like 'en-US'.
languages.title: Languages

onlyMainContent.description: If true, attempts to extract only the main article content, excluding headers, footers, navigation bars, and ads. Defaults to true.
onlyMainContent.title: Only Main Content

timeout.description: Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for the scraping request to complete. Defaults to 30000.
timeout.title: Timeout

url.description: The fully qualified URL of the web page to scrape.
url.title: Url

waitFor.description: Time in milliseconds to wait for the page to load or for dynamic content to render before starting the scrape. Defaults to 0.
waitFor.title: Wait For

inputParameters.title: ScrapeRequest
inputParameters.description:
Defines the parameters for a scrape request to Firecrawl, enabling web page content retrieval,
main content filtering, and optional structured data extraction using LLM capabilities.

data.description: Contains all scraped content and metadata.
data.title: Data

javascriptReturns.description: Array of results from JavaScript execution during actions, each containing 'type' and 'value'.
javascriptReturns.title: Javascript Returns

pdfs.description: Array of PDF URLs extracted during actions.
pdfs.title: Pdfs

scrapes.description: Array of scrape results from action sequences, each containing 'url' and 'html'.
scrapes.title: Scrapes

screenshots.description: Array of screenshot URLs captured during actions.
screenshots.title: Screenshots

branding.description: Brand identity information extracted from the website
branding.title: Branding

animations.description: Animation and transition settings detected on the site.
animations.title: Animations

colors.description: Primary, secondary, accent, background, and text colors used on the site.
colors.title: Colors

components.description: Styling information for UI components like buttons and inputs.
components.title: Components

fonts.description: Array of font families detected on the site.
fonts.title: Fonts

images.description: URLs for logo, favicon, and Open Graph images.
images.title: Images

layout.description: Layout configuration including grid and header/footer dimensions.
layout.title: Layout

personality.description: Brand personality traits including tone and target audience information.
personality.title: Personality

spacing.description: Spacing information including base unit, border radius, padding and margins.
spacing.title: Spacing

typography.description: Typography settings including font sizes, weights, families, and line heights.
typography.title: Typography

diff.description: Text diff showing what changed between scrapes.
diff.title: Diff

previousScrapeAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of the previous scrape operation.
previousScrapeAt.title: Previous Scrape At

html.description: Processed and cleaned HTML content of the page. Returned when 'html' is included in formats parameter.
html.title: Html

json.description: Structured data extracted using LLM with optional schema or prompt. Returned when using extract/JSON mode.
json.title: Json

links.description: Array of URLs extracted from the page.
links.title: Links

markdown.description: Page content converted to LLM-ready markdown format. Returned when 'markdown' is included in formats parameter.
markdown.title: Markdown

metadata.description: Comprehensive metadata about the scraped page including Open Graph tags and HTTP information.
metadata.title: Metadata

cache_state.description: Indicates cache hit or miss status.
cache_state.title: Cache State

content_type.description: MIME type of the scraped content.
content_type.title: Content Type

credits_used.description: Number of API credits consumed by this scrape operation.
credits_used.title: Credits Used

description.description: Page description from meta description tag.
description.title: Description

error.description: Error message if an error occurred during scraping.
error.title: Error

language.description: Detected or declared language code of the page content.
language.title: Language

ogImage.description: Open Graph image URL meta property.
ogImage.title: Og Image

ogLocaleAlternate.description: Array of alternate locale codes from Open Graph.
ogLocaleAlternate.title: Og Locale Alternate

ogSiteName.description: Open Graph site name meta property.
ogSiteName.title: Og Site Name

ogUrl.description: Open Graph canonical URL meta property.
ogUrl.title: Og Url

robots.description: Robots meta tag directives for crawlers.
robots.title: Robots

sourceURL.description: Original URL that was requested for scraping.
sourceURL.title: Source Url

statusCode.description: HTTP response status code from the scraping request.
statusCode.title: Status Code

title.description: Page title from the HTML title tag or meta tags.
title.title: Title

url.description: Final resolved URL after following redirects.
url.title: Url

rawHtml.description: Unprocessed raw HTML as received from the server. Returned when 'rawHtml' is included in formats parameter.
rawHtml.title: Raw Html

screenshot.description: Base64-encoded screenshot image or screenshot URL. Returned when 'screenshot' is included in formats parameter.
screenshot.title: Screenshot

summary.description: Concise AI-generated summary of the page content. Available in v2.5+.
summary.title: Summary

warning.description: Warning message if any issues occurred during scraping that didn't cause failure.
warning.title: Warning

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

success.description: Indicates whether the scrape operation completed successfully.
success.title: Success

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Search
tools.description: Performs a web search for a query, scrapes content from the top search results using Firecrawl, and returns details in specified formats.

country.description: Country code to tailor search results (e.g., 'us' for United States, default 'us').
country.title: Country

formats.description: Desired output formats for scraped content of each search result (e.g., 'markdown', 'html'). If None, default scraping applies. Available: 'markdown', 'html', 'rawHtml', 'links', 'screenshot', 'screenshot@fullPage'.
formats.title: Formats

lang.description: Language code for search results (e.g., 'en' for English, default 'en').
lang.title: Lang

limit.description: Maximum number of search results to return (1-10, default 5).
limit.title: Limit

timeout.description: Maximum time in milliseconds for search and scrape operations (1000-300000, default 60000).
timeout.title: Timeout

data.description: Contains search results organized by source type.
data.title: Data

images.description: Array of image search results. Available when 'images' is included in sources parameter.
images.title: Images

imageHeight.description: Height of the image in pixels.
imageHeight.title: Image Height

imageUrl.description: Direct URL to the image file.
imageUrl.title: Image Url

imageWidth.description: Width of the image in pixels.
imageWidth.title: Image Width

position.description: Ranking order or position of the image in search results.
position.title: Position

url.description: URL of the page containing the image.
url.title: Url

news.description: Array of news search results. Available when 'news' is included in sources parameter.
news.title: News

date.description: Publication date or timestamp of the news article.
date.title: Date

description.description: Description or summary of the news article.
description.title: Description

html.description: HTML content of the article. Included when scraping is enabled with html format.
html.title: Html

imageUrl.description: URL of the thumbnail or featured image for the news article.
imageUrl.title: Image Url

links.description: Array of extracted hyperlinks from the article. Included when scraping is enabled with links format.
links.title: Links

markdown.description: Article content in markdown format. Included when scrapeOptions specify markdown format.
markdown.title: Markdown

metadata.description: Contains metadata about the scraped news article.
metadata.title: MetadataResponse

error.description: Error message if scraping failed or encountered issues.
error.title: Error

sourceURL.description: Original source URL of the page.
sourceURL.title: Source Url

position.description: Ranking order or position of the news article in search results.
position.title: Position

rawHtml.description: Unprocessed raw HTML of the article. Included when scraping is enabled with rawHtml format.
rawHtml.title: Raw Html

screenshot.description: Base64-encoded screenshot of the article page. Included when scraping is enabled with screenshot format.
screenshot.title: Screenshot

snippet.description: Short excerpt or snippet from the news article.
snippet.title: Snippet

title.description: Headline or title of the news article.
title.title: Title

web.description: Array of web search results. Available when 'web' is included in sources parameter.
web.title: Web

description.description: Meta description or summary of the page content.
description.title: Description

html.description: HTML content of the page. Included when scraping is enabled with html format.
html.title: Html

links.description: Array of extracted hyperlinks from the page. Included when scraping is enabled with links format.
links.title: Links

markdown.description: Cleaned, structured content in markdown format. Included when scrapeOptions specify markdown format.
markdown.title: Markdown

metadata.description: Contains metadata about the scraped page.
metadata.title: Metadata

error.description: Error message if scraping failed or encountered issues.
error.title: Error

sourceURL.description: Original source URL of the page.
sourceURL.title: Source Url

rawHtml.description: Unprocessed raw HTML markup. Included when scraping is enabled with rawHtml format.
rawHtml.title: Raw Html

screenshot.description: Base64-encoded screenshot of the page. Included when scraping is enabled with screenshot format.
screenshot.title: Screenshot

title.description: Page title of the search result.
title.title: Title

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

success.description: Indicates whether the API request was successful.
success.title: Success

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

warning.description: Optional warning message about the request or response.
warning.title: Warning
